Package org.azeckoski.reflectutils

A set of reflection utilities and miscellaneous utilities related to working with classes and their fields with no dependencies which is compatible with java 1.5 and generics.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
ArrayUtils Utils for working with collections and arrays (these are basically convenience methods)
ClassData<T>  
ClassData.MemberComparator Sorts the members by visibility and name order
ClassDataCacher Class which provides access to the analysis objects and the cached reflection data
ClassFields<T>  
ClassLoaderUtils Utilities to help with operations that deal in ClassLoader and Class
ClassProperty Simple class for holding the values we care about for a single field, if it uses getters and setters then they must be like this:
If the fieldName is "thing" then:
getter: Object getThing() and setter: void setThing(Object value)
Warning: Note that the values in this object may be garbage collected at any time, do not store this object, it is meant for immediate short term use only
ClassProperty.IndexedProperty Slightly extended version with the extra indexed properties, indexed getters and setters must be setup like so:
If the fieldName is "thing" then:
getter: Object getThing(int index) and setter: void setThing(int index, Object value)
ClassProperty.MappedProperty Slightly extended version with the extra mapped properties, mapped getters and setters must be setup like so:
If the fieldName is "thing" then:
getter: Object getThing(String key) and setter: void setThing(String key, Object value)
The keys MUST be Strings
ConstructorUtils Class which provides methods for dealing with class constructors, also provides access to all the public constructors for a class
ConversionUtils Class which provides methods for converting between object types, can be extended with various converters
DateUtils Date conversion utilities, mostly for outputing dates in standard formats
DeepUtils Class which provides methods for handling deep operations:
deep copy - make a copy of one object into another which traverses the entire object and duplicates all data down to immutable/simple fields
deep clone - clone an object by traversing it and making a copy of every field
deep map - turn an object into a map with only simple objects in it, all contained objects become nested maps
populate - turn a map into an object, can handle params maps (from a servlet request) and nested or non-nested string->object maps
FieldUtils Class which provides methods for dealing with the fields in objects and classes, this provides the core functionality for the reflect util class

Setting and getting fields supports simple, nested, indexed, and mapped values:
Simple: Get/set a field in a bean (or map), Example: "title", "id"
Nested: Get/set a field in a bean which is contained in another bean, Example: "someBean.title", "someBean.id"
Indexed: Get/set a list/array item by index in a bean, Example: "myList[1]", "anArray[2]"
Mapped: Get/set a map entry by key in a bean, Example: "myMap(key)", "someMap(thing)"
FieldUtils.Holder  
ReflectUtils Reflection utilities and utilities related to working with classes and their fields

These are built to be compatible with Apache Commons BeanUtils and the nesting structure works the same, refer to the apache BeanUtils project docs for details

Handles field operations for properties (getters and setters), partial properties (only getter or only setter), and fields.
StringUtils Some simple utils to assist with string operations
TypeReference<T> A class which will sort of let us cheat and get to generics info at runtime if used correctly, derived from: http://gafter.blogspot.com/2006/12/super-type-tokens.html
 

Enum Summary
ClassFields.FieldFindMode Mode for finding the fields on classes/objects:
ClassFields.FieldFindMode.HYBRID (default)
ClassFields.FieldsFilter Indicates the fields filtering to use when retrieving fields from types/objects:
ClassFields.FieldsFilter.COMPLETE (default)
DeepUtils.CopyDestination  
 

Exception Summary
ClassFields.GetClassMethodException Indicates that this is the getter or setter for the class type and should be ignored
 

Package org.azeckoski.reflectutils Description

A set of reflection utilities and miscellaneous utilities related to working with classes and their fields with no dependencies which is compatible with java 1.5 and generics.

Features:

These are built to be compatible with Apache Commons BeanUtils and the nesting structure works the same, refer to the apache BeanUtils project docs for details. Support for Apache DynaClass / DynaBean is included. Current users of beanutils should be able to drop in these utilities and gain the functionality with minimal code changes.

Handles field operations for properties (getters and setters), partial properties (only getter or only setter), and fields. This is configurable to use the fields only, properties only, or the hybrid approach (default). This improves upon the BeanUtils limitation of handling only properties or the Google utilities limitation of handling only fields.

Getting and setting fields supports simple, nested, indexed, and mapped values

  • Simple: Get/set a field in a bean (or map), Example: "title", "id"
  • Nested: Get/set a field in a bean which is contained in another bean, Example: "someBean.title", "someBean.id"
  • Indexed: Get/set a list/array item by index in a bean, Example: "myList1", "anArray2"
  • Mapped: Get/set a map entry by key in a bean, Example: "myMap(key)", "someMap(thing)"
